intro: Conocephalus pubescens, commonly known as the hairy conocephalus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Conocephalus pubescens is valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
